74
75/*
76 Here's our wire format:
77
78 Stream = TaggedData*
79
80 TaggedData = Tag Length Data
81 where the integer value of 'Length' is the length of 'data'.
82
83 Tag = HByte* LByte
84 where HByte is a byte with the high bit set, and LByte is a byte
85 with the high bit clear. The integer value of the tag is taken
86 by concatenating the lower 7 bits from all the tags. So for example,
87 the tag 0x66 is encoded as [66], whereas the tag 0x166 is encoded as
88 [82 66]
89
90 Length = Integer
91
92 Integer = NNibbles Nibble* Padding?
93 where NNibbles is a 4-bit value encoding the number of nibbles-1,
94 and each Nibble is 4 bits worth of encoded integer, in big-endian
95 order. If the total encoded integer size is an odd number of nibbles,
96 a final padding nibble with value 0 is appended.
97*/
98
99int evtag_decode_int(ev_uint32_t *pnumber, struct evbuffer *evbuf);
100int evtag_decode_int64(ev_uint64_t *pnumber, struct evbuffer *evbuf);
101int evtag_encode_tag(struct evbuffer *evbuf, ev_uint32_t tag);
102int evtag_decode_tag(ev_uint32_t *ptag, struct evbuffer *evbuf);
103
104void
105evtag_init(void)
106{
107}
108
109/*
110 * We encode integers by nibbles; the first nibble contains the number
111 * of significant nibbles - 1; this allows us to encode up to 64-bit
112 * integers. This function is byte-order independent.
113 *
114 * @param number a 32-bit unsigned integer to encode
115 * @param data a pointer to where the data should be written. Must
116 * have at least 5 bytes free.
117 * @return the number of bytes written into data.
118 */
119
120#define ENCODE_INT_INTERNAL(data, number) do { \
121 int off = 1, nibbles = 0; \
122 \
123 memset(data, 0, sizeof(number)+1); \
124 while (number) { \
125 if (off & 0x1) \
126 data[off/2] = (data[off/2] & 0xf0) | (number & 0x0f); \
127 else \
128 data[off/2] = (data[off/2] & 0x0f) | \
129 ((number & 0x0f) << 4); \
130 number >>= 4; \
131 off++; \
132 } \
133 \
134 if (off > 2) \
135 nibbles = off - 2; \
136 \
137 /* Off - 1 is the number of encoded nibbles */ \
138 data[0] = (data[0] & 0x0f) | ((nibbles & 0x0f) << 4); \
139 \
140 return ((off + 1) / 2); \
141} while (/*CONSTCOND*/0)
142
143static inline int
144encode_int_internal(ev_uint8_t *data, ev_uint32_t number)
145{
146 ENCODE_INT_INTERNAL(data, number);
147}
148
149static inline int
150encode_int64_internal(ev_uint8_t *data, ev_uint64_t number)
151{
152 ENCODE_INT_INTERNAL(data, number);
153}
154
155void
156evtag_encode_int(struct evbuffer *evbuf, ev_uint32_t number)
157{
158 ev_uint8_t data[5];
159 int len = encode_int_internal(data, number);
160 evbuffer_add(evbuf, data, len);
161}
162
163void
164evtag_encode_int64(struct evbuffer *evbuf, ev_uint64_t number)
165{
166 ev_uint8_t data[9];
167 int len = encode_int64_internal(data, number);
168 evbuffer_add(evbuf, data, len);
169}
170
171/*
172 * Support variable length encoding of tags; we use the high bit in each
173 * octet as a continuation signal.
174 */
175
176int
177evtag_encode_tag(struct evbuffer *evbuf, ev_uint32_t tag)
178{
179 int bytes = 0;
180 ev_uint8_t data[5];
181
182 memset(data, 0, sizeof(data));
183 do {
184 ev_uint8_t lower = tag & 0x7f;
185 tag >>= 7;
186
187 if (tag)
188 lower |= 0x80;
189
190 data[bytes++] = lower;
191 } while (tag);
192
193 if (evbuf != NULL)
194 evbuffer_add(evbuf, data, bytes);
195
196 return (bytes);
197}
198
199static int
200decode_tag_internal(ev_uint32_t *ptag, struct evbuffer *evbuf, int dodrain)
201{
202 ev_uint32_t number = 0;
203 size_t len = evbuffer_get_length(evbuf);
204 ev_uint8_t *data;
205 size_t count = 0;
206 int shift = 0, done = 0;
207
208 /*
209 * the encoding of a number is at most one byte more than its
210 * storage size. however, it may also be much smaller.
211 */
212 data = evbuffer_pullup(
213 evbuf, len < sizeof(number) + 1 ? len : sizeof(number) + 1);
214 if (!data)
215 return (-1);
216
217 while (count++ < len) {
218 ev_uint8_t lower = *data++;
219 if (shift >= 28) {
220 /* Make sure it fits into 32 bits */
221 if (shift > 28)
222 return (-1);
223 if ((lower & 0x7f) > 15)
224 return (-1);
225 }
226 number |= (lower & (unsigned)0x7f) << shift;
227 shift += 7;
228
229 if (!(lower & 0x80)) {
230 done = 1;
231 break;
232 }
233 }
234
235 if (!done)
236 return (-1);
237
238 if (dodrain)
239 evbuffer_drain(evbuf, count);
240
241 if (ptag != NULL)
242 *ptag = number;
243
244 return count > INT_MAX ? INT_MAX : (int)(count);
245}
246
247int
248evtag_decode_tag(ev_uint32_t *ptag, struct evbuffer *evbuf)
249{
250 return (decode_tag_internal(ptag, evbuf, 1 /* dodrain */));
251}
252
253/*
254 * Marshal a data type, the general format is as follows:
255 *
256 * tag number: one byte; length: var bytes; payload: var bytes
257 */
258
259void
260evtag_marshal(struct evbuffer *evbuf, ev_uint32_t tag,
261 const void *data, ev_uint32_t len)
262{
263 evtag_encode_tag(evbuf, tag);
264 evtag_encode_int(evbuf, len);
265 evbuffer_add(evbuf, __UNCONST(data), len);
266}
267
268void
269evtag_marshal_buffer(struct evbuffer *evbuf, ev_uint32_t tag,
270 struct evbuffer *data)
271{
272 evtag_encode_tag(evbuf, tag);
273 /* XXX support more than UINT32_MAX data */
274 evtag_encode_int(evbuf, (ev_uint32_t)evbuffer_get_length(data));
275 evbuffer_add_buffer(evbuf, data);
276}
277
278/* Marshaling for integers */
279void
280evtag_marshal_int(struct evbuffer *evbuf, ev_uint32_t tag, ev_uint32_t integer)
281{
282 ev_uint8_t data[5];
283 int len = encode_int_internal(data, integer);
284
285 evtag_encode_tag(evbuf, tag);
286 evtag_encode_int(evbuf, len);
287 evbuffer_add(evbuf, data, len);
288}
289
290void
291evtag_marshal_int64(struct evbuffer *evbuf, ev_uint32_t tag,
292 ev_uint64_t integer)
293{
294 ev_uint8_t data[9];
295 int len = encode_int64_internal(data, integer);
296
297 evtag_encode_tag(evbuf, tag);
298 evtag_encode_int(evbuf, len);
299 evbuffer_add(evbuf, data, len);
300}
301
302void
303evtag_marshal_string(struct evbuffer *buf, ev_uint32_t tag, const char *string)
304{
305 /* TODO support strings longer than UINT32_MAX ? */
306 evtag_marshal(buf, tag, string, (ev_uint32_t)strlen(string));
307}
308
309void
310evtag_marshal_timeval(struct evbuffer *evbuf, ev_uint32_t tag, struct timeval *tv)
311{
312 ev_uint8_t data[10];
313 int len = encode_int_internal(data, tv->tv_sec);
314 len += encode_int_internal(data + len, tv->tv_usec);
315 evtag_marshal(evbuf, tag, data, len);
316}
317
318#define DECODE_INT_INTERNAL(number, maxnibbles, pnumber, evbuf, offset) \
319do { \
320 ev_uint8_t *data; \
321 ev_ssize_t len = evbuffer_get_length(evbuf) - offset; \
322 int nibbles = 0; \
323 \
324 if (len <= 0) \
325 return (-1); \
326 \
327 /* XXX(niels): faster? */ \
328 data = evbuffer_pullup(evbuf, offset + 1) + offset; \
329 if (!data) \
330 return (-1); \
331 \
332 nibbles = ((data[0] & 0xf0) >> 4) + 1; \
333 if (nibbles > maxnibbles || (nibbles >> 1) + 1 > len) \
334 return (-1); \
335 len = (nibbles >> 1) + 1; \
336 \
337 data = evbuffer_pullup(evbuf, offset + len) + offset; \
338 if (!data) \
339 return (-1); \
340 \
341 while (nibbles > 0) { \
342 number <<= 4; \
343 if (nibbles & 0x1) \
344 number |= data[nibbles >> 1] & 0x0f; \
345 else \
346 number |= (data[nibbles >> 1] & 0xf0) >> 4; \
347 nibbles--; \
348 } \
349 \
350 *pnumber = number; \
351 \
352 return (int)(len); \
353} while (/*CONSTCOND*/0)
354
355/* Internal: decode an integer from an evbuffer, without draining it.
356 * Only integers up to 32-bits are supported.
357 *
358 * @param evbuf the buffer to read from
359 * @param offset an index into the buffer at which we should start reading.
360 * @param pnumber a pointer to receive the integer.
361 * @return The length of the number as encoded, or -1 on error.
362 */
363
364static int
365decode_int_internal(ev_uint32_t *pnumber, struct evbuffer *evbuf, int offset)
366{
367 ev_uint32_t number = 0;
368 DECODE_INT_INTERNAL(number, 8, pnumber, evbuf, offset);
369}
370
371static int
372decode_int64_internal(ev_uint64_t *pnumber, struct evbuffer *evbuf, int offset)
373{
374 ev_uint64_t number = 0;
375 DECODE_INT_INTERNAL(number, 16, pnumber, evbuf, offset);
376}
377
378int
379evtag_decode_int(ev_uint32_t *pnumber, struct evbuffer *evbuf)
380{
381 int res = decode_int_internal(pnumber, evbuf, 0);
382 if (res != -1)
383 evbuffer_drain(evbuf, res);
384
385 return (res == -1 ? -1 : 0);
386}
387
388int
389evtag_decode_int64(ev_uint64_t *pnumber, struct evbuffer *evbuf)
390{
391 int res = decode_int64_internal(pnumber, evbuf, 0);
392 if (res != -1)
393 evbuffer_drain(evbuf, res);
394
395 return (res == -1 ? -1 : 0);
396}
397
398int
399evtag_peek(struct evbuffer *evbuf, ev_uint32_t *ptag)
400{
401 return (decode_tag_internal(ptag, evbuf, 0 /* dodrain */));
402}
403
404int
405evtag_peek_length(struct evbuffer *evbuf, ev_uint32_t *plength)
406{
407 int res, len;
408
409 len = decode_tag_internal(NULL, evbuf, 0 /* dodrain */);
410 if (len == -1)
411 return (-1);
412
413 res = decode_int_internal(plength, evbuf, len);
414 if (res == -1)
415 return (-1);
416
417 *plength += res + len;
418
419 return (0);
420}
421
422int
423evtag_payload_length(struct evbuffer *evbuf, ev_uint32_t *plength)
424{
425 int res, len;
426
427 len = decode_tag_internal(NULL, evbuf, 0 /* dodrain */);
428 if (len == -1)
429 return (-1);
430
431 res = decode_int_internal(plength, evbuf, len);
432 if (res == -1)
433 return (-1);
434
435 return (0);
436}
437
438/* just unmarshals the header and returns the length of the remaining data */
439
440int
441evtag_unmarshal_header(struct evbuffer *evbuf, ev_uint32_t *ptag)
442{
443 ev_uint32_t len;
444
445 if (decode_tag_internal(ptag, evbuf, 1 /* dodrain */) == -1)
446 return (-1);
447 if (evtag_decode_int(&len, evbuf) == -1)
448 return (-1);
449
450 if (evbuffer_get_length(evbuf) < len)
451 return (-1);
452
453 return (len);
454}
455
456int
457evtag_consume(struct evbuffer *evbuf)
458{
459 int len;
460 if ((len = evtag_unmarshal_header(evbuf, NULL)) == -1)
461 return (-1);
462 evbuffer_drain(evbuf, len);
463
464 return (0);
465}
466
467/* Reads the data type from an event buffer */
468
469int
470evtag_unmarshal(struct evbuffer *src, ev_uint32_t *ptag, struct evbuffer *dst)
471{
472 int len;
473
474 if ((len = evtag_unmarshal_header(src, ptag)) == -1)
475 return (-1);
476
477 if (evbuffer_add(dst, evbuffer_pullup(src, len), len) == -1)
478 return (-1);
479
480 evbuffer_drain(src, len);
481
482 return (len);
483}
484
485/* Marshaling for integers */
486
487int
488evtag_unmarshal_int(struct evbuffer *evbuf, ev_uint32_t need_tag,
489 ev_uint32_t *pinteger)
490{
491 ev_uint32_t tag;
492 ev_uint32_t len;
493 int result;
494
495 if (decode_tag_internal(&tag, evbuf, 1 /* dodrain */) == -1)
496 return (-1);
497 if (need_tag != tag)
498 return (-1);
499 if (evtag_decode_int(&len, evbuf) == -1)
500 return (-1);
501
502 if (evbuffer_get_length(evbuf) < len)
503 return (-1);
504
505 result = decode_int_internal(pinteger, evbuf, 0);
506 evbuffer_drain(evbuf, len);
507 if (result < 0 || (size_t)result > len) /* XXX Should this be != rather than > ?*/
508 return (-1);
509 else
510 return result;
511}
512
513int
514evtag_unmarshal_int64(struct evbuffer *evbuf, ev_uint32_t need_tag,
515 ev_uint64_t *pinteger)
516{
517 ev_uint32_t tag;
518 ev_uint32_t len;
519 int result;
520
521 if (decode_tag_internal(&tag, evbuf, 1 /* dodrain */) == -1)
522 return (-1);
523 if (need_tag != tag)
524 return (-1);
525 if (evtag_decode_int(&len, evbuf) == -1)
526 return (-1);
527
528 if (evbuffer_get_length(evbuf) < len)
529 return (-1);
530
531 result = decode_int64_internal(pinteger, evbuf, 0);
532 evbuffer_drain(evbuf, len);
533 if (result < 0 || (size_t)result > len) /* XXX Should this be != rather than > ?*/
534 return (-1);
535 else
536 return result;
537}
538
539/* Unmarshal a fixed length tag */
540
541int
542evtag_unmarshal_fixed(struct evbuffer *src, ev_uint32_t need_tag, void *data,
543 size_t len)
544{
545 ev_uint32_t tag;
546 int tag_len;
547
548 /* Now unmarshal a tag and check that it matches the tag we want */
549 if ((tag_len = evtag_unmarshal_header(src, &tag)) < 0 ||
550 tag != need_tag)
551 return (-1);
552
553 if ((size_t)tag_len != len)
554 return (-1);
555
556 evbuffer_remove(src, data, len);
557 return (0);
558}
559
560int
561evtag_unmarshal_string(struct evbuffer *evbuf, ev_uint32_t need_tag,
562 char **pstring)
563{
564 ev_uint32_t tag;
565 int tag_len;
566
567 if ((tag_len = evtag_unmarshal_header(evbuf, &tag)) == -1 ||
568 tag != need_tag)
569 return (-1);
570
571 *pstring = mm_malloc(tag_len + 1);
572 if (*pstring == NULL) {
573 event_warn("%s: malloc", __func__);
574 return -1;
575 }
576 evbuffer_remove(evbuf, *pstring, tag_len);
577 (*pstring)[tag_len] = '\0';
578
579 return (0);
580}
581
582int
583evtag_unmarshal_timeval(struct evbuffer *evbuf, ev_uint32_t need_tag,
584 struct timeval *ptv)
585{
586 ev_uint32_t tag;
587 ev_uint32_t integer;
588 int len, offset, offset2;
589 int result = -1;
590
591 if ((len = evtag_unmarshal_header(evbuf, &tag)) == -1)
592 return (-1);
593 if (tag != need_tag)
594 goto done;
595 if ((offset = decode_int_internal(&integer, evbuf, 0)) == -1)
596 goto done;
597 ptv->tv_sec = integer;
598 if ((offset2 = decode_int_internal(&integer, evbuf, offset)) == -1)
599 goto done;
600 ptv->tv_usec = integer;
601 if (offset + offset2 > len) /* XXX Should this be != instead of > ? */
602 goto done;
603
604 result = 0;
605 done:
606 evbuffer_drain(evbuf, len);
607 return result;
608}
